User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; Intel Mac OS X 10.6; rv:2.0.1) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/4.0.1
Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; Intel Mac OS X 10.6; rv:2.0.1) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/4.0.1

When customizing the refresh/stop buttons during a page reload, it's possible for the reload button to disappear semi-permanently when the toolbar is in Icon only mode.

Reproducible: Always

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Setup a webpage that will never finish loading (e.g., permanent sleep in a PHP script)
2. Customize your toolbar and place the Reload button to the left of the address bar so it's not merged with the address bar, and set to only show Icons. Place the stop button to the right of the reload button, and finish customizing. The buttons will merge
3. Access the webpage
4. While it is loading, customize the toolbar again and move the Stop button to the left of the Reload button, then finish customizing
5. Press the Stop button

Actual Results:  
After you perform the steps above Reload will be gone. Removing Stop does not bring Reload back. Moving Reload to other locations in the toolbar will not bring it back. Changing to show only Text, or Icons with Text will bring Reload back only while in those modes.

Expected Results:  
Expected result is to have Reload replace Stop.
comments.creator: brent.bloxam@gmail.com

comments.raw_text:
Reproduced.
Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux x86_64; rv:6.0a1) Gecko/20110524 Firefox/6.0a1

I used the following PHP-script:
                                        
<html>
  <head>
    <title>PHP zzzzzzz</title>
  </head>
  <body>
    <?php sleep(10000); ?>
  </body>
</html>

Note: I got my Reload button back after I restarted Firefox.
comments.creator: mozilla@ahlblom.eu
